dataplunger package¶

aggregate_processors¶

Aggregate processors perform changes on an entire set of records.

class dataplunger.aggregate_processors.AggregateProcessorBaseClass(processor, **kwargs)[source]¶

Abstract Base Class implementing an interface for Aggregate Processsors.

Methods subclasses must override:

  • __init__(): takes an input processor to decorate, and any kwargs.
  • _process(): takes a list of records, calls ‘process()’ method of decorated processor. Method returns modified list of records.

Methods subclasses can inherit (not required to override):

  • process() - responsible for calling _process followed by _log().
  • _log() - Responsible for executing logging if overridden. Takes a list of records as input.
__init__(processor, **kwargs)[source]¶
Parameters:processor – A decorated processor object to be executed.

class dataplunger.aggregate_processors.AggregateProcessorCSVWriter(processor, path, fields, **kwargs)[source]¶

Write records to an output CSV file.

Required Config Parameters:

Parameters:
  • path (str) – Absolute path for output CSV file.
  • fields (list) – A list of field names to output.

Example configuration file entry:

{"AggregateProcessorCSVWriter": {
    "path":"/path/to/out_data.csv",
    "fields": ["Age", "Gender", "Name"]
}}

class dataplunger.aggregate_processors.AggregateProcessorDevNull(RecordConstructor)[source]¶

ProcessorDevNull serves as the last processor in the chain for a specific record. It ends the processing chain by appending the final aggregate modified set of records back to the record constructor.

class dataplunger.aggregate_processors.AggregateProcessorSortRecords(processor, sortby, **kwargs)[source]¶

Perform ascending sort for a collection of records by a given key.

Required Config Parameters:

Parameters:sortby (str) – Field name (dict key) to sort by.

Example configuration file entry:

"AggregateProcessorSortRecords": {
    "sortby": "CITY_NAME"
}

core¶

Contains configuration and control code.

class dataplunger.core.Configuration[source]¶

This class is responsible the conversion of a JSON-formatted configuration file into a python object.

Parameters:
  • inConfigPath (str) – The full pathway to a JSON-formatted configuration file.
  • parsed_configs (dict) – Configuration info populated by parsedConfig.

Not implemented. Validate we have all required attributes.

class dataplunger.core.Controller(config, config_name)[source]¶

Given a configuration object, manage the creation of RecordConstructor instances, one for each layer.

Parameters:
  • config – Config instance to be passed to the controller.
  • config_name – Name of the individual config within a ConfigCollection to be processed.
__init__(config, config_name)[source]¶
_get_reader()[source]¶

Based on a Config Object’s conn_info type attribute, generate an appropriate reader.

createRecordConstructors()[source]¶

Create a Reader class instance. Create a RecordConstructor for each layer. Initiate processing calling the RecordConstructor’s serialize() method.

exception dataplunger.core.NoProcessorException[source]¶

An exception raised when no processors are passed to the controller.

class dataplunger.core.RecordConstructor(reader, layer_name, layer_config_params, record_processors=None, aggregate_processors=None)[source]¶

A RecordConstructor is composed of a reader and n-number of processors. The RecordConstructor is responsible for actually iterating through a datasource, provided by self.reader, and processing it using self.processors.

Parameters:
  • reader – reader class responsible for connecting to a data source.
  • layer_name – layer name extracted from a configuration file.
  • layer_config_parameters – layer parameters extracted from a configuration file.
  • record_processors – processor class references to be applied to a record.
  • aggregate_processors – aggregate Processor class references to be applied to a record.
  • records (list) – processed record.
__init__(reader, layer_name, layer_config_params, record_processors=None, aggregate_processors=None)[source]¶
_build_decorated_classes(data, initial_processor, processors, BaseClass)[source]¶

For Record and Aggregate processors, apply decorators and begin processing.

_get_processor_instance(name, base_class)[source]¶

Given a string, test if a Processor class exists by that name.

serialize()[source]¶

Using the reader classes’ context manager, loop through a reader’s contents using the reader’s __iter__() method. Output is written (serialized) using the Processor class’s process() method.

processors¶

Processors perform changes on an individual record.

class dataplunger.processors.ProcessorBaseClass(processor, **kwargs)[source]¶

Abstract Base Class implementing an interface for Processsors.

Methods subclasses must override:

  • __init__(): takes an input processor to decorate, and any kwargs
  • _process(): takes a single parsed record as a dictionary of field names and field values. Method calls the ‘process()’ method of a decorated processor. Method returns the modified version of the record.

Methods subclasses can inherit (not override):

  • process() - Responsible for calling _process() followed by _log().
  • _log() - Responsible for executing logging if overridden. Takes modified record as input.
__init__(processor, **kwargs)[source]¶
Parameters:processor – A decorated processor object to be executed.

class dataplunger.processors.ProcessorMatchValue(processor, matches=None, action='Keep', **kwargs)[source]¶

Keep or discard a record that matches a user-defined field-value pair. A match will be subjected to the action specified in the “action” param.

Required Config Parameters:

Parameters:
  • matches (dict) – Field names (keys) and field entries (values).
  • action (str) – Either “Keep” or “Discard”. DEFAULTS to “Keep”.

If multiple matches are provided, a hit of any match will trigger the action.

Example configuration file entry:

{"ProcessorMatchValue": {
    "matches":{"SumLevel":140},
    "action":"Keep"
}}
__init__(processor, matches=None, action='Keep', **kwargs)[source]¶
_abc_cache = <_weakrefset.WeakSet object at 0x1081d36d0>¶
_abc_negative_cache = <_weakrefset.WeakSet object at 0x1081d3750>¶
_abc_negative_cache_version = 20¶
_abc_registry = <_weakrefset.WeakSet object at 0x1081d3610>¶
_process(inLine)[source]¶

Iterate through our user-provided list of matches. If we find a match, take action specified by user.

_take_action(inLine, match_found)[source]¶

If record meets criteria for inclusion, keep it processing.

class dataplunger.processors.ProcessorTruncateFields(processor, fields, **kwargs)[source]¶

A decorator class which implements a Processor class’ public interface, the process() method. Designed to truncate a record to a specific set of fields.

Parameters:fields (list) – field names to keep.

Example configuration file entry:

{"ProcessorTruncateFields": {
        "fields": ["Total", "Male", "Female", "SUMLEVEL", "LOGRECNO"]
}}

readers¶

Readers are responsible for creating a connection to a backing datasource, and returning an iterable that yields a single record of data from that datasource.

class dataplunger.readers.ReaderBaseClass(conn_info)[source]¶

An abstract base class for a Reader interface.

class dataplunger.readers.ReaderCSV(conn_info)[source]¶

Reader class implementation for CSV files.

Required Config Parameters:

Parameters:
  • conn_info – the connection information (pathway) for a given CSV file.
  • conn_info.path – attribute containing the actual file path.

Example configuration file entry:

{
"name": "KC Election Data",
"conn_info": {
    "type": "ReaderCSV",
    "path": "/Users/matt/Projects/dataplunger/sample_data/election_2010_kc.csv",
    "delimeter": ",",
    "encoding": "UTF-8"
}
__enter__()[source]¶

Open a file connection, pass that to an instance of csv.DictReader

__exit__(exc_type, exc_val, exc_tb)[source]¶

Close the file handler.

__init__(conn_info)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • conn_info – the connection information (pathway) for a given file.
  • delimiter – extracted from conn_info, defaults to ‘,’
  • _file_handler – set in __enter__(), a read only pointer to the CSV.
  • _dict_reader – an instance of csv.dict_reader()

_abc_negative_cache_version = 20¶
_abc_registry = <_weakrefset.WeakSet object at 0x1081ccad0>¶
class dataplunger.readers.ReaderCensus(conn_info)[source]¶

Reader class implementation for Census ACS Summary Files.

Required Config Parameters:

Parameters:
  • conn_info – contains path and sequence attributes (see below).
  • conn_info.path – contains a pathway to an ACS formatted directory of estimate and geography tables.
  • conn_info.sequence – Sequence No. From, ‘Sequence_Number_and_Table_Number_Lookup.xls’
  • conn_info.starting_position – Starting Position for table of int. From, ‘Sequence_Number_and_Table_Number_Lookup.xls’
  • conn_info.fields – an array of field names with line numbers. From, ‘Sequence_Number_and_Table_Number_Lookup.xls’

Example configuration file entry:

{
"name": "Sex By Age",
"conn_info": {
    "type": "ReaderCensus",
    "path": "/path/to/folder/of/EstimatesAndGeographyTables",
    "delimiter": ",",
    "encoding": "UTF-8",
    "fields": {
        "Total": 1,
        "Male": 2,
        "Female": 17
    },
    "sequence": 2,
    "starting_position": 87
}
__enter__()[source]¶

Call internal setup functions.

__exit__(exc_type, exc_val, exc_tb)[source]¶
__init__(conn_info)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • conn_info – contains path and sequence attributes (see above).
  • delimiter – extracted from conn_info, defaults to ‘,’.
  • _estimate_reader – csv.reader instance parsing estimate tables.
  • _estimate_handler – file handler for estimate file.
  • _estimate_path – path to estimate file, generated based on user provided path and sequence value.
  • _geography_path – path to geography file, generated based on user provided path.
  • _geography_records – populated by parsing a geography file. a dictionary populated with keys representing LOGRECNO values for a given row, and values representing the first six fields of that row.
_abc_cache = <_weakrefset.WeakSet object at 0x1081ccd50>¶
_abc_negative_cache = <_weakrefset.WeakSet object at 0x1081ccdd0>¶
_abc_negative_cache_version = 20¶
_abc_registry = <_weakrefset.WeakSet object at 0x1081ccc90>¶
_build_estimate_reader()[source]¶

Create a CSV reader using the estimate file. Reformat starting_position and individual field indexes for use in list lookup.

_build_logrecno_dict()[source]¶

Create a dictionary of LOGRECNO values with associated attributes. Will be used as a lookup during iteration of estimate table.

_get_paths()[source]¶

Build paths for the geography and estimate files. Geography files begin a ‘g’ and have a CSV extension. Estimate files are based on the sequence number.
